verses.verse: Wisdom <WH2454> hath built<WH1129> her house,<WH1004> she hath hewn out<WH2672> her seven<WH7651> pillars: <WH5982>
She hath killed<WH2873> her beasts;<WH2874> she hath mingled<WH4537> her wine;<WH3196> she hath also<WH637> furnished<WH6186> her table.<WH7979>
She hath sent forth<WH7971> her maidens:<WH5291> she crieth<WH7121> upon<WH5921> the highest places<WH1610> <WH4791> of the city,<WH7176>
Whoso <WH4310> is simple,<WH6612> let him turn<WH5493> in hither:<WH2008> as for him that wanteth<WH2638> understanding,<WH3820> she saith<WH559> to him,
Come, <WH1980> eat<WH3898> of my bread,<WH3899> and drink<WH8354> of the wine<WH3196> which I have mingled.<WH4537>
Forsake <WH5800> the foolish,<WH6612> and live;<WH2421> and go<WH833> in the way<WH1870> of understanding.<WH998>
He that reproveth<WH3256> a scorner<WH3887> getteth<WH3947> to himself shame:<WH7036> and he that rebuketh<WH3198> a wicked<WH7563> man getteth himself a blot.<WH3971>
Reprove <WH3198> not<WH408> a scorner,<WH3887> lest<WH6435> he hate<WH8130> thee: rebuke<WH3198> a wise man,<WH2450> and he will love<WH157> thee.
Give <WH5414> instruction to a wise<WH2450> man, and he will be yet<WH5750> wiser:<WH2449> teach<WH3045> a just<WH6662> man, and he will increase<WH3254> in learning.<WH3948>
The fear<WH3374> of the LORD<WH3068> is the beginning<WH8462> of wisdom:<WH2451> and the knowledge<WH1847> of the holy<WH6918> is understanding.<WH998>
For <WH3588> by me thy days<WH3117> shall be multiplied,<WH7235> and the years<WH8141> of thy life<WH2416> shall be increased.<WH3254>
If <WH518> thou be wise,<WH2449> thou shalt be wise<WH2449> for thyself: but if thou scornest,<WH3887> thou alone<WH905> shalt bear<WH5375> it.
A foolish<WH3687> woman<WH802> is clamorous:<WH1993> she is simple,<WH6615> and knoweth<WH3045> nothing.<WH1077> <WH4100>
For she sitteth<WH3427> at the door<WH6607> of her house,<WH1004> on<WH5921> a seat<WH3678> in the high places<WH4791> of the city,<WH7176>
To call<WH7121> passengers<WH5674> <WH1870> who go right<WH3474> on their ways: <WH734>
Whoso <WH4310> is simple,<WH6612> let him turn<WH5493> in hither:<WH2008> and as for him that wanteth<WH2638> understanding,<WH3820> she saith<WH559> to him,
Stolen <WH1589> waters<WH4325> are sweet,<WH4985> and bread<WH3899> eaten in secret<WH5643> is pleasant.<WH5276>
But he knoweth<WH3045> not<WH3808> that<WH3588> the dead<WH7496> are there;<WH8033> and that her guests<WH7121> are in the depths<WH6011> of hell.<WH7585>
